name: 000_pub_x_and_get
expected_full_outputs:
*** Pub ***

You are in your family's pub. Sunlight streams through the windows showing a room full of well-worn tables and chairs with a large bar standing across from the entrance. Any moment the regulars will arrive, clamoring for their favorite brews, arguing loudly over sports and poltics, and hurling darts in the general direction of the dart board - and the pub will ignite with sound and motion.

There is a Creaky Door to the south.

There is a Dingy Shelf here. The Dingy Shelf contains: a Rusty Key. 

There is a Comfy Chair here. The Comfy Chair is empty. 

The following items are here: a Tea Cup (containing a Tea). 

You give yourself a self-concious once-over: at age 19 and the youngest daughter of Ethan Brewer, the prosperous owner of the town's busiest pub, you should be well on your way towards matrimony - but to your mother's dismay and your own deep relief, it appears to be nowhere on the horrizon. Of course you're also the more homely and introverted daughter - more fond of books than boys they say. Your older sister, Chrissy, the queen of the viallage, has always had a dozzen men at a time circling her in eratic orbits, moths to the flame - so who would ever notice you?

In your off hand you hold a Brass Lantern.

I don't see a Lantern here.

*** Pub ***

You are in your family's pub. Sunlight streams through the windows showing a room full of well-worn tables and chairs with a large bar standing across from the entrance. Any moment the regulars will arrive, clamoring for their favorite brews, arguing loudly over sports and poltics, and hurling darts in the general direction of the dart board - and the pub will ignite with sound and motion.

There is a Creaky Door to the south.

There is a Dingy Shelf here. The Dingy Shelf contains: a Rusty Key. 

There is a Comfy Chair here. The Comfy Chair is empty. 

The following items are here: a Tea Cup (containing a Tea). 

The front door to your familie's pub (and home, since you live on the second floor). It's always had a ferocious creak to it.

The Creaky Door is closed. On the Creaky Door you see: Block Text. 

'Brewer's Corner Pub (close the door ya' fool!)'

The Creaky Door is locked.

*** Pub ***

You are in your family's pub. Sunlight streams through the windows showing a room full of well-worn tables and chairs with a large bar standing across from the entrance. Any moment the regulars will arrive, clamoring for their favorite brews, arguing loudly over sports and poltics, and hurling darts in the general direction of the dart board - and the pub will ignite with sound and motion.

There is a Creaky Door to the south.

There is a Dingy Shelf here. The Dingy Shelf contains: a Rusty Key. 

There is a Comfy Chair here. The Comfy Chair is empty. 

The following items are here: a Tea Cup (containing a Tea). 

The Dingy Shelf is in urgent need of dusting - but it's a pretty high shelf so you haven't gotten to it lately.

The Dingy Shelf contains: a Rusty Key. 

An old Rusty Key... the one they claim opens the front gate to Dark Castle. Just last night, wasn't Burt bragging that he would take it and storm the castle and use the gold to buy everyone drinks?

Taken

(with the Rusty Key)

You attempt to unlock the Creaky Door but the Rusty Key appears to be the wrong key.

*** Pub ***

You are in your family's pub. Sunlight streams through the windows showing a room full of well-worn tables and chairs with a large bar standing across from the entrance. Any moment the regulars will arrive, clamoring for their favorite brews, arguing loudly over sports and poltics, and hurling darts in the general direction of the dart board - and the pub will ignite with sound and motion.

There is a Creaky Door to the south.

There is a Dingy Shelf here. The Dingy Shelf is empty. 

There is a Comfy Chair here. The Comfy Chair is empty. 

The following items are here: a Tea Cup (containing a Tea). 

The Comfy Chair is a bit ragged around the edges but still cozy to curl up in. It's a small oasis of relaxation amidst a sea of ale-fuled raucousness.

The Comfy Chair is empty. 

Hand cast from river-side clay by your mother and perfectly proportioned, this is your favorite Tea Cup.

On the Tea Cup you see: Cursive. The Tea Cup contains: a Tea. 

'A drink with jam and bread'

Look at that - a perfectly brewed cup of tea. If only you could get a quiet moment to enjoy it.

You can't 'take' a liquid but you can 'drink' a liquid or you can 'take' a container that holds a liquid.

Taken

You are now seated in the Comfy Chair.

Your favorite comfy chair - the perfect place for a sip of tea!

(from the Tea Cup)

Drunk.

Ah tea, what a devine beverage it is!

Your score is now 10 out of 10

Upon sipping your hot tea from your favorite Tea Cup, a deep sense serenity comes over you. This was the moment of peace you needed. You feel ready to face the day.

You have won!

Your adventure ended after 20 moves.

Your score is now 10 out of 10

Your title is: Cecily the Serene

The A Cup of Tea game was written and programmed by Tom.
